name: TheAtlantic
text: Jacinda Ardern’s victory foreshadows the challenge facing all world leaders in the months and years ahead, writes @YasmeenSerhan. Though succeeding in the face of the pandemic is hard, dealing with its aftermath could be harder. https://t.co/0DdRVhVRQr

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Jacinda Ardern showed the world how leading a country through a global health crisis is done. Today, New Zealanders rewarded her with a historic majority. 

But if succeeding in the face of the pandemic is hard, dealing with its aftermath could be harder:
https://t.co/Zgw6SXFJjn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Everyone’s favourite world leader just won re-election. Yet, as ⁦@YasmeenSerhan⁩ writes in ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩, successfully managing the pandemic may not be the hardest part of Jacinda Ardern’s job. https://t.co/cgU1nWlxSX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "One recent post is a video by the anti-vaccinationist Robert F. Kennedy Jr., wrongly suggesting that mercury-laced vaccines are shipped to predominantly Black communities...." -- 
Important, from @olgakhazan:
https://t.co/lo9gToLRLd

name: TheAtlantic
text: When wealth inequality is increasing and the spaces where humans can live comfortably are shrinking, the heat gap between rich and poor might be the world’s most daunting challenge, Vann R. Newkirk II writes. https://t.co/BAezp3p7Nj

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: QAnon, a pro-Trump conspiracy theory, isn’t going away. Here are three things to consider as you think about the theory's rise to prominence: https://t.co/6YEscqrsjX

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Over the past decade,” Ruth S. Barrett writes, “the for-profit ecosystem that has sprouted up around athletic recruiting at top-rung universities has grown so excessively ornate, so circular in its logic, that it’s become self-defeating.” https://t.co/VmiHByh7Rz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Key segments of the community—specifically Cubans and younger U.S.-born Mexican Americans—support the Republican Party in numbers large enough to mitigate explosive new registration numbers among more Democratic-leaning Latinos," @madrid_mike writes: https://t.co/wYVoTsYvWc

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When the military succeeds in promoting meritocracy and banishing prejudice, the benefits accrue to American society as a whole," James L. Jones writes: https://t.co/prGgzHKyeZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "One of the great failings of the modern Democratic Party is that its technocratic elite often permitted themselves to govern in the realm of abstraction, to construct overly elaborate blueprints." Read @FranklinFoer's latest:  https://t.co/cBA4okVo3F

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "During my 40 years as a Marine officer.... I came to believe that one of the military’s most important missions is to lead the fight against hate, inequality, and injustice, both at home and overseas." 

-- Gen. James Jones
